intro: Senecio octolepis var. octolepis, commonly known as the blue ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. The species is also known for its ability to store water in its leaves, making it drought-tolerant.
